name: Independence Creek Tour
summary: A classic backcountry creek ride in North Idaho.

name: Bernard Peak Loop
summary: A North Idaho A++ ride.  A great climb with a rewarding downhill.

name: Lost Lake Loop
summary: Another fun, Sandpoint-area ride with great views of Lake Pend Oreille.

name: Bead Lake Loop
summary: A great loop with great climbing, beautiful scenery and a fun yet challenging mountain lake trail.

name: Bernard Peak - Scout Trail Option
summary: A fun outing with a flowy forested downhill from Bernard Peak and great views of Lake Pend Oreille.

name: Timber Mountain Loop
summary: The ride not to miss. A long, fast and flowing descent.

name: Timber Mountain - Buck Mountain Trail Loop
summary: A great ride to a rarely visited section of the Cabinet Mountains.

name: Orville Heath/Kelly Pass Loop
summary: Difficult loop that combines four trails into an epic high county loop.

name: Sherwood Forest Trail
summary: If you like tight switchbacks, some technical features, and a flying through trees, this is it.

name: Gold Hill Trail (Trail 3)
summary: A beautiful local trail that offers great views and a rewarding climb.

name: Lower Basin II XC
summary: This trail heads between the 4th & 2nd switchbacks with sweeping bermed turns and 850' up or down.

name: Bernard Peak Trail (#37)
summary: A local North Idaho Trail that offers a big, backcountry experience!

name: Highpoint Trail
summary: Highpoint is a well designed epic singletrack with killer views.

name: Chilco Mountain NRT #14
summary: A challenging ride with a huge mountain top viewing experience of northern Idaho!

name: Lower Basin Trail (DH)
summary: A fun and fast descent with small and large jumps.

name: Dover Overlook Trail
summary: Follow this trail to a fabulous viewpoint of Dover and the Pend Oreille River.

name: Butterfly
summary: A fast and flowy fat bike ride that starts and finishes in the Pine Street Woods parking lot.

name: Ermine Ridge Trail
summary: A classic backcountry ride in North Idaho.

name: Crooked Tree
summary: A short climb from the parking lot at Pine Street Woods to a viewpoint overlooking the Pend Oreille River and Mt. Baldy.

name: Apache Ridge #2
summary: Ride what is left of our good old roads to the top of Roman Nose.

name: Lower Basin Trail (XC)
summary: An excellent XC trail with great climbing rhythm or a twisting and turning descent.

name: Sidewinder
summary: Another great Mike Kirkpatrick designed trail!

name: Mineral Point Trail 82
summary: A great sandpoint area trail offering spectacular views of Lake Pend Oreille.

name: Upper Basin
summary: A fast and shifty trail when ridden downhill or a great climb with a couple of sharp ups.

name: ViewSki Loop
summary: A 1.2-mile singletrack with great tread, super flow up or down, and awesome views!

name: Greta's Segway
summary: A flowing singletrack through trees with some technical sections, a couple bridges.

name: Tesemini Trail - West
summary: A fast, maneuvering cross country trail.

name: The Rollers
summary: A nice but STEEP singletrack.

name: Timber Mountain Trail #51
summary: One of the best singletrack trails in the Kootenai National Forest.

name: Beaver Bay Shoreline Loop Trail
summary: A fun, technical trail with amazing views of Lake Pend Oreille.

name: F.L.O. Trail
summary: You may ask how did I get here?... Bermed turns packed into a sweet north slope.

name: Willow Lakeview Loop Trail
summary: A short, smooth trail that rolls through beautiful scenery.

name: Pin Ball
summary: A fun, energetic, tight-turning trail.

name: Independence Creek #22
summary: A classic backcountry creek trail in northern Idaho.

name: Lost Lake Trail 81
summary: A fast and flowing Sandpoint trail.

name: Bier Bridge Trail
summary: A great beginner/intermediate singletrack.

name: Buck Mountain Trail #176
summary: A great high country trail in a rarely visited area of the Cabinet Mountains.

name: Meadow Trail
summary: An easy and pleasant singletrack.

name: Cardiac Bypass
summary: This is a great trailhead, especially in the spring when other sections are muddy.

name: Little John
summary: Little John is the newest addition to the Sherwood Forest trail system.

name: East Declaration Trail #416
summary: A classic backcountry ride in North Idaho.

name: Smythe Creek Trail #515
summary: A steep, loose, and fun descent from the Buck Mountain Trail #176.

name: Telemark Trail
summary: Also known as Upper Basin Extension.

name: Bear Grass
summary: Lift assisted DH trail at Schweitzer mountain.

name: Sparky
summary: Just one part of the buffest singletrack in Northern Idaho

name: Bronze Bay Trail
summary: A fast, winding, downhill twist!

name: Lynx Trail
summary: A fun, fast rolling interior trail in Farragut State Park.

name: Woodrat Trail
summary: A short trail from Outlet Campground to Hills Resort.

name: Pipeline Trail
summary: This is the quickest way back up to ride the sweet downhill tracks nearby.

name: Bunco ORV/Power Line Trail (Trail 6001)
summary: A peaceful doubletrack that rolls fast and climbs hard.

name: Scout Trail (#49)
summary: A fun connector from Bernard Peak Trail (#37) and Highpoint Trail with challenging rock gardens.

name: Lake Terrace Road
summary: Flowy, scenic doubletrack that offers great views of Spirit Lake and the surrounding mountains.

name: Stimson Doubletrack Connector
summary: Straightforward doubletrack connecting Bernard Peak Trail to E. Twete Road

name: Lower F.L.O.
summary: Perhaps the best beginner trail at Schweitzer.

name: NF 2708 - Bernard Peak
summary: A connector Forest Service road to the top of Bernard Peak

name: Fault Lake Trail #59
summary: Hey, I road it when I was 12 with a full pack. How bad could it be?

name: Bunco High Drive / FS 332 (NF 209)
summary: An uphill Forest Service connector route to get to Bernard Peak.

name: Waterfall Trail
summary: A 500-foot descent in 1 mile to a great series of cascading pools.

name: Boulder Creek Road
summary: An old road that has been converted into a singletrack trail on the southern end.

name: Mud Lake Trail 91
summary: A deep woods trail offering some fun lines and energetic flow

name: Corkscrew Trail
summary: A short and steep trail with twisty bermed corners.

name: Orange Trail
summary: Mostly fast singletrack with some steeper switchbacks at the bottom of the loop.

name: Highpoint Trail
summary: Adopt me, please!

name: Heart Rate Hill - Will definitely get your heart racing on the way up. A very sweet section with some nice open forest.
